titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Story of Italy Lecture Series, Yale University, Transcripts and Videotapes
Story of Italy Lecture Series, Yale University, Transcripts and Videotapes
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday January 19, 2019 at 08:18

did.unittitle: Story of Italy lecture series, Yale University, transcripts and videotapes

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of transcripts and U-matic videotapes of the Yale Story of Italy lectures series.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of Public Information

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 4-C (YRG 4-C), Records documenting public information functions of Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are available for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Story of Italy Lecture Series, Yale University, Transcripts and Videotapes (RU 835). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in two series: Series I. Transcripts of Lectures. Series II. Videotapes.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Story of Italy series, Yale University's first venture into educational programming for television, was organized by Thomas G. Bergin, Sterling Professor Emeritus of Romance Languages and prepared for television by the Office of Public Information. The series consists of thirty-five half-programs by faculty members on the history and culture of Italy. It aired on WTNH-TV in 1974 and 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of transcripts and U-matic videotapes of the Yale Story of Italy lectures series.

controlaccess.corpname: Yale University. Office of Public Information
